column4: i`ve got problem with manually installing a packages , after i execute "make" in terminal it show the next this "make[4]: Leaving directory `/home/kaloqn/Desktop/gdb-6.8/gdb/gdbserver'"
what`s that mean
there must be a more descriptive error message on the output
gdb is avaialble from the repositories, you should use it instead
shall it works i want to see assembly language on linux
there is no advantage on building gdb by your own, the packages are available to make your life easier
sudo apt-get install gdb
it looks like it is install "0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded."
so it is already installed
how do i started
well, you realy need to read some tutorial/manual about gdb, gdb is a complex tool
man gdb (is a good start)
i hope so do you know assembly language in linux ?
not, I don't use assembly language since 10 years agos
looks like you`ve got huge experience in programing
yes, anyway, you should not use assembly unless you need to learn it, or you need a low level hardware function
